author: @portalmvd
title: Inumet emitió una alerta amarilla y otra naranja por mal tiempo: mirá a dónde afectan
text: Montevideo Portal El Instituto Uruguayo de Meteorología (Inumet) emitió una alerta amarilla y otra naranja por mal tiempo. Según el comunicado del organismo, una perturbación atmosférica asociada a una masa de aire húmeda e inestable afecta al país, lo que genera tormentas y lluvias intensas. En las zonas comprendidas por las advertencias se podrán registrar lluvias copiosas, caída de granizo, intensa actividad eléctrica y rachas de vientos fuerte. Alerta naranja: zonas afectadas Paysandú: Beisso, Casa Blanca, Cerro Chato, Chacras de Paysandú, Chapicuy, Colonia Nuevo Paysandú, Constancia, Esperanza, Gallinal, Guayabos, Guichón, Lorenzo Geyres, Merinos, Orgoroso, Paysandú, Piedras Coloradas, Porvenir, Quebracho, Tambores y Termas de Guaviyú. Río Negro: Algorta, Gartental, General Borges, Menafra, Paso de los mellizos, Tres Quintas, Villa María y Young. Salto: Albisu, Biassini, Campo de Todos, Cayetano, Cerro de Vera, Colonia 18 de Julio, Colonia Itapebí, Fernández, Garibaldi, Itapebí, Puntas de Valentín, Quintana, Salto, San Antonio y Termas del Daymán. Tacuarembó: Arerungua, Balneario Iporá, La Pedrera, Paso Bonilla, Paso del Cerro, Piedra Sola, Sauce de Batoví, Tacuarembó y Tambores. Alerta amarilla: zonas afectadas Artigas: Todo el departamento Río Negro: Bellaco, El Ombú, Nuevo Berlín y Sarandí de Navarro. Rivera: Cerros de la Calera, Lagos del Norte, Masoller, Minas de Corrales, Paso Ataques y Tranqueras. Salto: Arapey, Belén, Constitución, Lluveras, Migliaro, Rincón de Valentín, Sarandí de Arapey, Saucedo y Termas del Arapey. Tacuarembó: Curtina y Pueblo de Arriba. Advertencia meteorológica naranja y amarilla por Tormentas fuertes y lluvias intensas— Inumet (@MeteorologiaUy) Se actualizará a las 08:00 o ante cambios significativos Más info: [https://t.co/zY2u8OFmLu] [pic.twitter.com/6Qbfrn2noD] [November 1, 2024] Montevideo Portal

author: Adriana Robreño
title: Capital de Ecuador destinará 900 millones de dólares a limpiar ríos
text:
Con ese objetivo se construirán 22 plantas, tres en el sector urbano y 19 en zonas rurales, afirmó la alcaldía.
Además, se construirán 500 kilómetros de interceptores sanitarios (túneles) para recoger las aguas residuales y conducirlas a la respectiva planta de tratamiento.
Este anuncio llega luego de que un tribunal de Ecuador dictaminó el pasado 5 de julio que la contaminación ha violado los derechos del río Machángara, que atraviesa la urbe, y en consecuencia el gobierno municipal deberá implementar medidas para el control de fluidos industriales.
El Machángara es la vía de desfogue de gran parte de las aguas residuales del sur de la ciudad y, según el ayuntamiento capitalino, ya se han construido algunos túneles interceptores sanitarios para recoger un 86 por ciento de las descargas de las aguas residuales.
Si bien el municipio apeló la sentencia, para activistas y ecologistas es una victoria legal que no solo representa un avance significativo para el Machángara, sino también un precedente importante en la protección de los derechos de la naturaleza en Ecuador.
La estrategia municipal incluye la recuperación de otros ríos quiteños afectados por el mismo problema, como el San Pedro y Monjas, así como la descontaminación de la cuenca alta del río Esmeraldas, que corre por la costa norte del país y que se nutre de varios afluentes de Quito.
rgh​​/avr

author: VNExplorer
title: Tesla lance une nouvelle Model Y en Europe avec un record d’autonomie à la clef
text:
Tesla vient de dévoiler une nouvelle version de sa voiture électrique phare, la Model Y Grande Autonomie à Propulsion. Au programme : une autonomie théorique de 600 km et un tarif plus abordable que la version Transmission Intégrale qui propose une autonomie inférieure.
Les informations non officielles se multipliaient ses dernières semaines autour de la sortie d’une nouvelle Tesla Model Y en Europe. Le constructeur américain vient de mettre fin à l’attente, en dévoilant la Tesla Model Y Grande Autonomie Propulsion (Long Range RWD). Une stratégie qui avait déjà été mise en place avec l’ancienne Tesla Model 3 Grande Autonomie Propulsion.
600 km d’autonomie en une charge Au programme : une batterie NMC (Nickel-Manganèse-Cobalt) d’une capacité de 79 kWh, mais un seul moteur sur l’essieu arrière. C’est ce qui permet d’annoncer 600 km d’autonomie sur le cycle WLTP avec les petites jantes de 19 pouces. En passant, en option, sur du 20 pouces, l’autonomie tombe à 565 km.
Jamais une Tesla Model Y n’aura eu autant d’autonomie. Et pour cause, elle reprend la grande batterie de la version Grande Autonomie à Transmission Intégrale (Long Range AWD), mais n’a plus le droit au moteur avant. À titre de comparaison, la Tesla Model Y Propulsion se limite à une batterie de 60 kWh pour une autonomie de 455 km sur le cycle WLTP.
Tesla Model Y Autonomie Prix Propulsion 455 km 44 990 € Grande Autonomie Propulsion 600 km 48 990 € Grande Autonomie Transmission Intégrale 565 km 51 990 € Performance 514 km 57 990 € La nouvelle Tesla Model Y Grande Autonomie Propulsion fait également mieux que la version 60 kWh en termes de performances, car son moteur est plus puissant (a priori entre 220 et 255 kW, soit entre 300 et 346 ch). De quoi abattre le 0 à 100 km/h en 5,9 secondes. La vitesse maximale est toujours de 217 km/h, comme sur les autres versions de la Model Y.
Pas encore disponible en France Étonnamment, cette nouvelle version de la voiture la plus vendue dans le monde en 2023 n’est pas encore disponible en France. Mais sur le configurateur allemand et espagnol, on peut déjà la commander, contre 48 990 euros, avec un délai de 2 à 4 semaines. C’est plus cher que la version Propulsion (vendue 44 990 euros) mais moins cher que la version Grande Autonomie Transmission Intégrale (51 990 euros).
On imagine qu’elle devrait rapidement être disponible en France. Mais son tarif l’empêchera d’avoir le droit au bonus écologique, dont le plafond est de 47 000 euros. Sauf si Tesla se décide à appliquer un prix inférieur en France, ce qui est également possible.
Tesla Model Y
Pas de signe, en revanche, d’un éventuel restylage. Rappelons que la Tesla Model Y vendue en Chine depuis quelques mois profite de certaines améliorations de la nouvelle Tesla Model 3 améliorée, à l’image de la planche de bord et de la bande LED dans l’habitacle. On note aussi des enjoliveurs noirs, et non pas gris, et un tout nouveau système matériel (HW 4.0) pour gérer l’Autopilot, le système de conduite semi-autonome. Mais toutes ces nouveautés se font encore attendre en Europe.

author: Natalie Ortiz
title: Healthcare Access for Undocumented Migrants in SA
text:
South Africa’s Healthcare Fault Lines: Navigating a Future of Limited Resources and Rising Xenophobia Over 7 million foreign nationals reside in South Africa, a significant portion of whom are undocumented. While the country’s constitution guarantees healthcare access to all within its borders, a confluence of factors – dwindling public resources, rising anti-immigrant sentiment, and localized enforcement actions – is creating a precarious situation. Healthcare access for this vulnerable population is increasingly becoming a battleground, not just of legal rights, but of social cohesion and public health strategy. Recent incidents, like the blockade of the Hillbrow Clinic by Operation Dudula, are not isolated events, but symptoms of a deeper systemic strain.
The Legal Landscape: Rights vs. Reality South Africa’s National Health Act stipulates that emergency medical treatment must be provided to all, regardless of legal status. However, beyond emergency care, the situation is far more ambiguous. The Department of Health’s policies have historically been inconsistent, leading to varying levels of access across provinces and facilities. This ambiguity, coupled with a chronic shortage of healthcare professionals and infrastructure, creates a fertile ground for discrimination and denial of services. The Human Rights Commission’s (HRC) concerns regarding reported denials of care underscore the urgent need for clarity and enforcement of existing legal frameworks.
The Strain on Public Resources: A Looming Crisis The core of the issue isn’t necessarily a legal one, but a practical one: capacity. South Africa’s public healthcare system is already overburdened, struggling to meet the needs of its own citizens. The influx of migrants, particularly those seeking economic opportunities, exacerbates this strain. This has fueled resentment, particularly amongst communities experiencing limited access to essential services themselves. ActionSA’s stance, while controversial, taps into this very real anxiety about the perceived “abuse” of public healthcare by “illegal foreigners.” The narrative, however, often overlooks the systemic failures that contribute to the problem, rather than solely blaming migrants.
The Rise of Xenophobia and its Impact on Healthcare The recent actions of groups like Operation Dudula, directly obstructing access to healthcare facilities, represent a dangerous escalation. These incidents aren’t simply about healthcare; they are manifestations of broader xenophobic tendencies within South African society. Denying healthcare based on nationality not only violates constitutional rights but also poses a significant public health risk. Untreated illnesses, particularly infectious diseases, can easily spread across communities, impacting everyone regardless of their immigration status. This creates a perverse incentive to *increase* healthcare access for all, not restrict it.
Future Scenarios: Three Potential Pathways Looking ahead, three potential scenarios emerge:
Continued Fragmentation: The current trend of inconsistent policy, localized enforcement, and rising xenophobia continues. This leads to further erosion of trust in the healthcare system, increased health risks for migrants, and potential for social unrest. Centralized Policy & Increased Funding: The national government implements a clear, unified policy on healthcare access for migrants, backed by increased funding for public health infrastructure and personnel. This requires political will and a commitment to addressing the root causes of resentment. Privatization & Tiered Access: Pressure on the public system leads to increased privatization of healthcare services, creating a tiered system where migrants are largely excluded from affordable care. This would exacerbate existing inequalities and potentially lead to a humanitarian crisis. The most likely scenario, unfortunately, is a continuation of the first, unless proactive measures are taken. The key lies in acknowledging the systemic challenges, addressing the root causes of xenophobia, and investing in a more resilient and equitable healthcare system.
Projected Healthcare Demand vs. Capacity in South Africa (2024-2030)
The Role of Technology and Innovation While systemic changes are crucial, technology can play a vital role in bridging the healthcare gap. Telemedicine, mobile health clinics, and digital health records can extend access to remote and underserved communities, including migrant populations. Furthermore, data analytics can help identify areas of greatest need and optimize resource allocation. However, these solutions must be implemented equitably, ensuring that language barriers and digital literacy are addressed.
The situation demands a holistic approach – one that recognizes healthcare as a fundamental human right, acknowledges the realities of resource constraints, and proactively addresses the underlying social and political factors driving xenophobia. Ignoring these complexities will only lead to a further deterioration of the healthcare system and a deepening of social divisions.
Frequently Asked Questions About Healthcare Access for Migrants in South Africa Q: Is healthcare free for undocumented migrants in South Africa?
A: Emergency medical treatment is legally mandated to be free for everyone, regardless of their immigration status. However, access to non-emergency care is often limited and subject to various restrictions and challenges.
Q: What is the government doing to address the healthcare needs of migrants?
A: The government’s response has been inconsistent. While some provinces have implemented programs to improve access, there is a lack of a unified national strategy and sufficient funding.
Q: How can I help improve healthcare access for migrants in South Africa?
A: You can support organizations working to provide healthcare to vulnerable populations, advocate for policy changes that promote equitable access, and challenge xenophobic attitudes within your community.
What are your predictions for the future of healthcare access for migrants in South Africa? Share your insights in the comments below!

author: ArcaMax Publishing, Inc.
title: Greg Cote's Week 17 NFL picks | Football | ArcaMax Publishing
text:
Our 10-6 mark straight up last week was tolerable. The 5-11 stinker against the spread, not so much. I picked a bad week to have a bad week, dipping just below .500 ATS with only two weeks left. Ouch. The near-miss on our Upset of the Week was indicative. Titans led 17-13 with one minute left but fell to Seattle. I was off by two points on Jets’ win. Not good enough. Had Ravens with the points at San Fran Monday night and that was about it for the highlights. Must finish strong! [Note: Our Thursday night pick was @Browns (-7) over Jets, 19-13.]
———
Week 16: 10-6, .625 overall; 5-11, .313 vs. spread.
Season: 147-93, .613 overall; 114-117-9, .494 vs. spread.
———

 GAME OF THE WEEK
DOLPHINS (11-4) at RAVENS (12-3)

author: 马新社
title: 过去5年全国通报24地陷，霹州11宗最多
text:
根据马来西亚矿物及地质科学局（JMG）记录，大马过去5年共通报24宗地陷事件，而霹雳占11宗高居榜首。
天然资源及环境永续部在国会网站发布的书面答复中说，吉隆坡和槟州分别录得3宗地陷事件、吉兰丹2宗；森美兰、吉打、雪兰莪、马六甲和玻璃市各1宗。
“本部门通过矿物及地质科学局向来致力在涉及地陷地质灾害敏感地区的开发区，降低发生地质灾害的风险。”
环境部是在回答伊党勿述国会议员仄莫哈末祖基菲里的质询。这名民意代表要求环境部说明，国内在过去5年通报的地陷事件总数，以及其应对举措。

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - The Apprentice contestants secure record-breaking £38.7m in Formula-E task
text: The Apprentice contestants secure record-breaking £38.7m in Formula-E task Team Nexus smashed the show’s previously held largest winning sales record of £1.2 million. The winning figure is more than 30 times the previously held record, achieved in series 15 during the electric bikes task. Lord Alan Sugar asked his supervisors Baroness Karren Brady and Tim Campbell to unveil the figures in full.
